item.title: Overview
item.description: When it comes to sweetness in drinks bartenders often think of adjusting it by changing the amount of syrup added to the drink. Sometimes that is not ideal, maybe the cocktail has already been prebatched or maybe changing the amount of syrup will throw off texture. Sweetness is a perception and there are many levers we can pull to adjust a drinks perception besides replying on the amount of “sweet” we pour into our drinks.
